body:
Comment 1: 
I am not sure this is necessary given that it already works. However,
I do see the parallel with input and output parameter lists, and I
understand wanting to make receiver lists use the same grammar, so I'd
go along with this.

Since we seem to be on a parenthesization kick, the errors about
parenthesization in the gc compiler are:

yyerror("cannot parenthesize type in composite literal");
yyerror("cannot parenthesize receiver type");
yyerror("cannot parenthesize embedded type");

I believe that the type in a composite literal and the embedded type
in a struct definition are special enough that we should keep the
restrictions there.
